title: I.Sicily inscription 000780
support: Three joining fragments of a marble plaque, with a border/moulding on the upper part, broken on all sides.

layout.p: Large letters regularly laid out over multiple lines below a moulding.

handNote.lettering: Large well spaced and reasonably broad v-cut monumental letters.

provenanceFound._: Found in late 1922 during work to construct a water pipe along via S. Agostino, which borders the western side of the Odeon; the stone was in re-use as the cover of a late-antique burial.

provenanceObserved._: Manganaro republished the lower right fragment in 1989 after observing it in the Roman theatre; Prag and Metcalfe did not locate it during study of material in storage at the theatre in 2016.
